summary: Webpack stats are being automatically logged with color codes and multiline formatting, making logs difficult to read in third-party logging systems and wasting money on per-line charges. User requests the ability to configure or disable these stats via Webpack's existing stats configuration.
userImpact: Users cannot control Webpack stats logging, leading to cluttered logs with color codes and multiline output that increases costs in pay-per-line logging systems.
rootCause: The SDK hardcodes Webpack stats configuration in bundler.ts without providing user control over the stats output.
proposedFix: Allow stats to be controlled via Webpack's existing stats configuration options, similar to how webpackConfigHook works.
workaround: Pass a custom logger to bundleWorkflowCode to replace the default logging behavior.
resolutionDetails: Issue was resolved by allowing users to control logging through a custom logger parameter in bundleWorkflowCode.
keyQuote: Allow stats to be controlled via Webpack's existing stats configuration. At a minimum, document the fact that these log lines cannot be toggled.
